result.execSummary:
The defendant Dontrell R Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Entry into/onto Bldg/Constuct.Site/Room, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.15(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Submit a DNA sample, pay DNA surcharge.
Court will waive any costs and surcharges that can be waived. Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory costs and surcharges commencing October 1, 2015 at the rate of $25.00 per month, or as penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dontrell R Richardson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief rcvd & filed.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP case.

Defendant Dontrell R Richardson in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction with credit for 30 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.  Court will waive any costs and surcharges that can be waived.  Court ordered defendant to pay ALL MANDATORY COSTS and SURCHARGES commencing October 1, 2015 at the rate of $25.00 per month or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

Defendant Dontrell R Richardson in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense motion to adjourn heard and granted by the Court; date selected with the parties.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Dontrell R Richardson not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant in custody on a VOP hold.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: EQM Construction - 3456 N Buffum St.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dontrell R Richardson in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Dontrell R Richardson in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
